alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 26 at 10:05AM EST until March 28 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC003-270315- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.Y.0006.000000T0000Z-220328T1500Z/ /PTTP1.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 1005 AM EST Sat Feb 26 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, MARCH 28... * WHAT...Flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh. * WHEN...Until Monday, March 28. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela Parking Wharf. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk between the stadiums. At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded. At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower areas of the North Shore Riverwalk. At 22.0 feet, The Tenth Street Bypass floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 20.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 16.7 feet Thursday morning. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
